creditline: Gift of Yang and Helen H. Wang
department: Chinese, South and Southeast Asian Art
description: central large blue-skinned figure with red hair and two flames extending from his mouth; standing figure in red, gold and blue robes at top center inside cloud of smoke extending from blue figure's head; man falling after chopping foot off with ax in ULC; person being devoured by a tiger in URC; man with ox cart at right edge below tiger; eight men at a banquet with musicians playing cymbals and flute at right edge below blue figure; bearded figure at an alter at left edge below blue figure; small nude and bare-chested figures with wild hair at bottom: climbing a red case with scrolls (?), wrestling snakes, preparing three giant vessels with food; figure bleeding out of eyes and mouth in LRC, with figure being trampled by leaping horse and headless man holding his head in his PL hand
dimension:
54 x 27 1/2 in. (137.16 x 69.85 cm) (image)
69 1/8 x 31 1/8 in. (175.58 x 79.06 cm) (overall, without roller)
title: Daoist Hell
